Detailed Description

template<unsigned D>
class extrude_base< D >

Base class for Extrude classes, providing the actual extrude() function.

Author:
Helge Preuss <scout@hyperspace-travel.de>

Member Function Documentation

template<unsigned D>
void extrude_base< D >::extrude ( unsigned  d  )  [inline]

Extrudes an object along a given dimension.

For each point in the vertex array, a copy is made and shifted along the d axis. Thus, a point becomes a line when extruded along axis 0, a line becomes a square when extruded along axis 1, and so on. A circle becomes a cylinder when extruded along axis 2, and similarly with all kinds of objects. You get the idea.

Parameters:
d The new dimension into which the object is extruded

Extrude vertices into the d axis, setting the d coordinate to 1

Extrude surfaces from each edge of the base surface to its image

add all surfaces which were in the old vertex array, but extruded along the d axis. This is achieved by copying the old surface array and adding the size of the old vertex array to each of the indices therein.

Remove double surfaces from area

References vertex_data< D >::addSurface(), vertex_data< D >::dimension(), std::vector< _Tp, _Alloc >::push_back(), vertex_data< D >::surface(), and vertex_data< D >::X().

Referenced by Extrude< D, Dmin, Dmin >::Extrude(), and Extrude< D, Dmin, Dmax >::Extrude().
